p: Serial dilutions of the essential oil (1125–72 µg/mL) and fluconazole (200–1 µg/mL) were used to assess their effect on mature biofilms, as reported elsewhere [ 61]. C. albicans density was adjusted to 1 × 10 6 CFU/mL and 100 μL of this suspension added to 96-well microtiter plates and incubated for 24 h at 37 °C for biofilm adhesion and formation, followed by 24 h at 37 °C in the presence or absence of the essential oils.
